<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 278, 235, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 243, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/41  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 216, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 696, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 85, 715, 207]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 225, 920, 262]]<|/det|>
Three coplanar forces of magnitudes \(100\mathrm{N},50\mathrm{N}\) and \(50\mathrm{N}\) act at a point \(A\), as shown in the diagram. The value of \(\cos \alpha\) is \(\frac{4}{5}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 274, 725, 293]]<|/det|>
Find the magnitude of the resultant of the three forces and state its direction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 275, 920, 293]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1800\mathrm{kg}\) is towing a trailer of mass \(400\mathrm{kg}\) along a straight horizontal road. The car and trailer are connected by a light rigid tow-bar. The car is accelerating at \(1.5\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{-2}\). There are constant resistance forces of \(250\mathrm{N}\) on the car and \(100\mathrm{N}\) on the trailer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 146, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 135, 410, 154]]<|/det|>
Find the tension in the tow-bar.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 798, 528]]<|/det|>
Find the power of the engine of the car at the instant when the speed is \(20 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 81, 714, 158]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 175, 920, 242]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a ring of mass \(0.1 \mathrm{~kg}\) threaded on a fixed horizontal rod. The rod is rough and the coefficient of friction between the ring and the rod is 0.8. A force of magnitude \(T \mathrm{~N}\) acts on the ring in a direction at \(30^{\circ}\) to the rod, downwards in the vertical plane containing the rod. Initially the ring is at rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 254, 148, 272]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 253, 653, 272]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest value of \(T\) for which the ring remains at rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 254, 920, 272]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 517, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the ring when \(T = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 83, 601, 230]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 247, 918, 299]]<|/det|>
A child of mass \(35\mathrm{kg}\) is swinging on a rope. The child is modelled as a particle \(P\) and the rope is modelled as a light inextensible string of length \(4\mathrm{m}\). Initially \(P\) is held at an angle of \(45^{\circ}\) to the vertical (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 310, 148, 327]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 310, 920, 344]]<|/det|>
Given that there is no resistance force, find the speed of \(P\) when it has travelled half way along the circular arc from its initial position to its lowest point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 326, 920, 343]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 361, 918, 380]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 400, 918, 419]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 439, 918, 457]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 477, 918, 495]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 515, 918, 533]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 552, 918, 570]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 590, 918, 608]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 628, 918, 645]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 738, 918, 756]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 775, 918, 793]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 812, 918, 830]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 850, 918, 867]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 885, 918, 903]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that there is a resistance force. The work done against the resistance force as \(P\) travels from its initial position to its lowest point is \(X \mathrm{J}\). The speed of \(P\) at its lowest point is \(4 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 223, 154]]<|/det|>
Find \(X\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A particle moves in a straight line \(AB\). The velocity \(v \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) of the particle \(t \mathrm{s}\) after leaving \(A\) is given by \(v = k(t^{2} - 10t + 21)\), where \(k\) is a constant. The displacement of the particle from \(A\), in the direction towards \(B\), is \(2.85 \mathrm{m}\) when \(t = 3\) and is \(2.4 \mathrm{m}\) when \(t = 6\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 136, 146, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 136, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\). Hence find an expression, in terms of \(t\), for the displacement of the particle from \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[242, 85, 791, 225]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 247, 920, 313]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.3 \mathrm{kg}\), lying on a smooth plane inclined at \(30^{\circ}\) to the horizontal, is released from rest. \(P\) slides down the plane for a distance of \(2.5 \mathrm{m}\) and then reaches a horizontal plane. There is no change in speed when \(P\) reaches the horizontal plane. A particle \(Q\) of mass \(0.2 \mathrm{kg}\) lies at rest on the horizontal plane \(1.5 \mathrm{m}\) from the end of the inclined plane (see diagram). \(P\) collides directly with \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 325, 146, 343]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 325, 920, 359]]<|/det|>
It is given that the horizontal plane is smooth and that, after the collision, \(P\) continues moving in the same direction, with speed \(2 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 371, 468, 390]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of \(Q\) after the collision.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 373, 920, 390]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the horizontal plane is rough and that when \(P\) and \(Q\) collide, they coalesce and move with speed \(1.2 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 688, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficient of friction between \(P\) and the horizontal plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
